multiple-choice.question: The Carleton Computer Science Society has a Board of Directors consisting of a President, two Vice-Presidents, and a five-person Advisory Board. The President cannot be Vice-President and cannot be on the Advisory Board. A Vice-President cannot be on the Advisory Board. Let $n$ be the number of students in Carleton's Computer Science program, where $n \geq 8$. In how many ways can a Board of Directors be chosen?
